site.tag: Expert interior painting, touch-ups, and custom paint design
site.copyright: © 2024 Paint To Think. All rights reserved.

about.title: About Us
about.content: Paint To Think specializes in premium painting services for apartments and condos. From quick touch-ups to full custom designs, we bring color and life to your space.

service-1.title: Full Interior Painting
service-1.details: Transform your entire living space with comprehensive interior painting. Walls, ceilings, trim, doors, and closets using premium low-VOC paints.

service-2.title: Touch-Up & Repair
service-2.description: Fix scuffs, holes, and wear marks
service-2.details: Expert touch-up services to repair nail holes, scuff marks, scratches, and minor wall damage. Perfect for move-out prep.

service-3.title: Custom Paint Design
service-3.details: Custom accent walls, geometric patterns, color blocking, and hand-painted murals. Create a one-of-a-kind look.

service-4.title: Move-Out Restoration
service-4.details: Professional paint restoration to return your unit to move-in condition. We match colors and ensure you get your deposit back.

service-5.title: Cabinet Refinishing
service-5.details: Update your kitchen or bathroom cabinets with professional refinishing at a fraction of replacement cost.

service-6.title: Color Consultation
service-6.details: Complimentary color consultation with every project. We help you choose colors you will love for years.

items.question: Can my landlord charge me for normal wear and tear?
items.answer: No. California law protects tenants from being charged for normal wear and tear. Minor scuffs, nail holes, and typical wear cannot be deducted from your security deposit.
items.citation: "No deduction may be made for...ordinary wear and tear."

items.question: Who is responsible for peeling paint?
items.answer: Your landlord. Peeling paint is a habitability issue. They must maintain the property in habitable condition, including fixing peeling or damaged paint.
items.citation: "The landlord of a dwelling shall put it in a fit condition for human habitation and repair all subsequent dilapidations."

items.question: Do I need permission to paint my rental?
items.answer: It depends on your lease. Some landlords allow painting with approval, others require restoration to original colors. Always check your lease agreement first.
items.citation: "Any deductions for repair of damages...shall be reasonable in relation to the damage."

items.question: What if I need to paint before moving out?
items.answer: Our touch-up service can help restore walls to move-in condition. We match original colors and ensure you get your full deposit back.
items.citation: "The landlord shall return the security within 21 days after the tenant has vacated."

items.question: Do you offer services in Russian?
items.answer: Yes! Our team includes Russian speakers. We provide clear communication in Russian from consultation to completion.

items.question: Can my landlord deduct for repainting if I lived there for years?
items.answer: No. Paint has a limited useful life (typically 2-3 years). If you lived in the unit for several years, repainting is considered normal wear and tear, not damage.
items.citation: "The landlord may not assert a claim against the tenant for...deterioration which results from normal wear and tear."

items.question: What if my landlord refuses to fix peeling paint?
items.answer: You have legal remedies. After proper notice, you may repair and deduct, or in serious cases, withhold rent until repairs are made.
items.citation: "If...the landlord neglects to do so, the tenant may repair the same himself...and deduct the expenses."

items.question: How long does it take to paint an apartment?
items.answer: Time depends on apartment size and scope of work. Typically, a full paint job for a one-bedroom takes 1-2 days, two-bedroom takes 2-3 days. We always provide accurate time estimates before starting.

items.question: What type of paint do you use?
items.answer: We use only premium low-VOC (volatile organic compounds) paints that are safe for health and environment. All paints are certified for quality and durability.

items.question: Do you provide a warranty on your work?
items.answer: Yes, we provide a warranty on all our work. If any issues arise with paint quality during the warranty period, we'll fix them at no charge.
